result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Thomas, Randy Alan
defendant.address: W333 N6472 Cty L, Oconomowoc, WI 53066

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 3:28pm
Defendant Randy Alan Thomas in court, in custody, with Attorney Bradley Novreske. ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Novreske indicates that there is recently received information regarding Mr. Thomas's pending out-of-county cases; he requests the scheduling of another status conference so that global discussions can be held regarding resolution of the cases. 
The Court raises the WCS letter-notice regarding non-payment of Scram program fees. The Court emphasizes to Mr. Thomas that he needs to make arrangements to make payments toward the amount due.
On request of Attorney Novreske, the Court allows the Scram monitoring bracelet to be removed during the Waukesha County 90 day jail term that Mr. Thomas has recently started to serve.  The Scram condition of Bond remains, so once Mr. Thomas has completed service of the jail term, he will need to have the Scram device re-installed before he is released from custody. 
The Court informs the partiers that this case will likely be reassigned to a different judge at the beginning of the new year due to judicial rotation; is this occurs, Attorney Novreske is to talk with Mr. Thomas about his rights regarding this. 
recess 3:33pm. 
[Post Hearing: in response to the clerk's inquiry regarding the Court allowing the Scram device to be removed while Mr. Thomas is incarcerated, serving the 90 day jail term, the Court indicates that if the Waukesha County Jail needs an order to effectuate this, then Attorney Novreske should submit a proposed order.] 
 
NEXT:  Status Conference on January 9th at 9:00am

Defendant Randy Alan Thomas in court.  Michael C. Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin. WCS Representative, Jonathan Reinke appears via telephone.

--Mr. Thomas indicates that he continues to seek employment

--No Response by Mr. Thomas

The Court requires $750 CASH bond with same conditions, Mr. Thomas will need to post an additional $500 cash to be released.

Mr. Thomas is to remain in custody, unless SCRAM is installed, WCS need not resume services until outstanding balance is satisfied.

--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license 
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.
The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 3/7/22 at 2:30 pm.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license 
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.
The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 3/7/22 at 2:30 pm.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
